node.Title: Cash App Pay available in US
node.Description: Businesses in the US can now reach new customers with Cash App Pay. Allow customers to pay with the wallet that's number one in both app stores.

node.Title: Sessions 2023: Powering growth for the internet economy
node.Description: At our annual user conference, we shared how we are helping businesses increase revenue with our global payments suite, how we are allowing platforms and marketplaces to generate more revenue and get to market faster, and how we are helping businesses find new efficiencies through developer tools and automated revenue and finance operations.

node.Title: Introducing Stripe Reader S700
node.Description: Build custom experiences for interactions from ordering to loyalty management—or run your custom POS on an all-in-one device.

node.Title: Collect payment details before creating an Intent
node.Description: Integrating and upgrading to the Payment Element is now easier than ever with server-side confirmation and a new integration path that lets you collect payment details before creating a PaymentIntent or SetupIntent.

node.Title: BNPL support expanded globally
node.Description: Businesses can now accept more buy now, pay later methods globally through one integration on Stripe: Klarna in AU, NZ, CA, CH, PT, PL, CZ, and GR; Affirm in CA.

node.Title: Improving Instant Payouts
node.Description: Today we’re introducing new and improved Instant Payouts features and functionality for platforms and marketplaces on Connect. Stripe is rolling out new tools that enable you to start, run, and manage an Instant Payouts program with a faster integration process, streamlined monetization, and no-code build options.

node.Title: Automatic currency conversion
node.Description: Businesses in the US and Canada using Checkout and Payment Links can now dynamically localize pricing to 30 countries with one click in the Dashboard.

node.Title: How we built it: Stripe Radar
node.Description: Radar is Stripe’s fraud prevention solution. This post covers what makes Radar so powerful and some of the key decisions we’ve made—and lessons we’ve learned—over the almost seven years we’ve been building it.

node.Title: Terminal expands to more countries in Europe
node.Description: Businesses can now accept in-person payments in Switzerland and Norway with Terminal's flexible APIs, SDKs, and pre-certified card readers.

node.Title: New Elements features to help you increase conversion at checkout
node.Description: New Elements Features to Increase Conversion | Stripe

node.Title: An embeddable and customizable fiat-to-crypto onramp
node.Description: Introducing an embeddable and customizable fiat-to-crypto onramp. Let customers buy crypto within your Web3 app with one click. Tailor the onramp to match your brand, and we’ll take care of the rest: KYC, fraud, and disputes.

node.Title: New Billing analytics functionalities
node.Description: You can now customize how Stripe calculates your MRR and churn, and export your SaaS and billing metrics in CSV format.

node.Title: Tap to Pay on iPhone now available in the US
node.Description: You can now accept in-person contactless payments with only an iPhone and Stripe Terminal—no additional hardware required.

node.Title: Stripe Identity mobile SDKs are now available in public beta
node.Description: Verify customers seamlessly in your Android or iOS app with the Stripe Identity mobile SDK. Get up and running quickly with a few lines of code.

node.Title: Set up the customer portal without code
node.Description: You can now set up a prebuilt customer portal in minutes–without a line of code–empowering your customers to manage their subscriptions, invoices, and payment details themselves.

node.Title: US Platforms payout expansion
node.Description: We’ve added local currency and crypto payouts coverage for US platforms to 110+ countries, making it easy to pay out to connected accounts all over the world.

node.Title: International support for Cartes Bancaires
node.Description: All Stripe businesses across Europe can now enable CB. Offer the largest card network in France to meet local preferences and increase acceptance rates with your French customers.

node.Title: How Stripe builds interactive docs with Markdoc
node.Description:
Delivering a good user experience without compromising the authoring experience required us to develop an authoring format that enables writers to express interactivity and simple page logic without mixing code and content. 

While developing Markdoc, we learned how to balance interactivity, customization, and authoring productivity while undertaking a major overhaul of our documentation platform.

node.Title: Streamline in-person payments with recent Stripe Terminal upgrades
node.Description: We’re continuously working on improving Terminal to help businesses better serve their customers, and we’re excited to share the latest updates that enable our users to reach more customers globally, start accepting in-person payments faster, and deliver a frictionless checkout experience for more use cases.

node.Title: BLIK
node.Description: European businesses on Stripe can now enable BLIK. The Polish payment system allows customers to complete a transaction via their banking app and greatly increases conversion.

node.Title: Reimagining bank transfers
node.Description: Bank transfers have been at the core of global payments since Western Union added money transfers to its telegram services in 1871, giving individuals the ability to move money across distances via an electronic communication network for the first time.

node.Title: Stripe, everywhere in the EU
node.Description: We've added support for businesses in Croatia—making Stripe available everywhere in the European Union. Businesses in Gibraltar and Liechtenstein can also sign up now.

node.Title: Affirm
node.Description: Businesses in the US can now offer Affirm to let customers pay for a large purchase over time. Eligible businesses can start accepting Affirm in minutes.

node.Title: Sessions 2022 and product highlights from the year
node.Description: Today, we kicked off our annual user conference—Stripe Sessions. You can now watch the keynote and breakout talks on demand.

node.Title: Introducing Stripe Apps
node.Description: Stripe Apps lets you embed custom user experiences directly in the Stripe Dashboard and orchestrate the Stripe API. Create an app to streamline operations just for your team or for the more than one million businesses using Stripe.

node.Title: Migrating millions of lines of code to TypeScript
node.Description: On Sunday, March 6, we migrated Stripe’s largest JavaScript codebase from Flow to TypeScript. In a single pull request, we converted more than 3.7 million lines of code. The next day, hundreds of engineers came in to start writing TypeScript for their projects.

node.Title: Stripe Data Pipeline
node.Description: Sync your Stripe data with your Redshift or Snowflake data warehouse.

node.Title: Stripe Tax is available for more businesses
node.Description: Stripe Tax can now be added to all Stripe Payments integrations to automatically calculate and collect sales tax, VAT, and GST via the new Orders API.

node.Title: Fast builds, secure builds. Choose two.
node.Description: Stripe's continuous integration (CI) system is responsible for orchestrating build pipelines and executing the tens of thousands of test suites that our engineers depend on to validate their changes. We lean on a combination of open-source technologies and novel engineering to deliver a CI system that is performant, secure, and delivers a delightful developer experience.
